subject: Sleep
title: The Invention of the Mattress
description: A quick win: understand The Invention of the Mattress.

hook.text: For most of history, people slept on straw, leaves, or animal skins. The comfortable mattress is shockingly recent.

buildup.text: The word mattress comes from Arabic matrah, meaning something thrown down, brought to Europe by Crusaders.

discovery.text: Cotton-stuffed mattresses appeared in the 18th century. Innerspring mattresses weren't invented until 1871.

twist.text: For centuries, straw mattresses harbored bedbugs, fleas, and lice. Burning the straw was the only remedy.

climax.text: Memory foam was invented by NASA in 1966 for astronaut seats and only reached bedrooms in the 1990s.

punchline.text: Your mattress has more technology than medieval kings could imagine.
